text: Does anyone know if the fields.json for modules get minified? I have noticed if you copy the module json it's minified but when you fetch down theme theme it's not? just wondering if this is done automatically by the cms as run time and would minification of json improve performance.

`fields.json` for both themes and modules is not minified because it’s never rendered on your site. It’s only used for fields in the editor. So in short the `fields.json` does not have a direct impact on your site performance.
I’m using `|escapejson` to escape html to put into a json object, but it doesn’t convert this to single line, as json doesn’t allow multiple lines. Does someone have a work around for this?

I actually wrote up a blog post last week about a project that needed me to convert some hubl into json. It doesnt go into depth on filters but there is a huge code snippet with my  json/hubl and all the filters associated <https://devbeej.com/library/advanced-exporting-HubSpot-blogs/>
